intro: Hydnocarpus curtisii, commonly known as the African tamarind tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a large evergreen tree that can grow up to 30 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, gray bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by hard, woody fruits that contain elliptical seeds. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
